intro: Argythamnia montevidensis, commonly known as the Montevideo thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Uruguay and parts of Argentina. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in regions with seasonal rainfall.
